root: ^You are now in the year 2050. You look outside your window and see...

s: ^People wearing gasmasks, standing in line to get more food rations.
^Factories keeping the world together to sustain the consumerist lifestyles.
^A green oasis with children joyfully playing outside.

c-0: ^You live in a world completely destroyed by a local factory. Your last food source has been destroyed by the pollution of this building. You have no other options for food anymore to survive.

^You have the option to destroy the factory to possibly save the food source of your community. But this means that the big part of the community will lose their job and bring possibly even more people hunger, if you are not able to come up with a new food source.

s: ^Don't destroy it.
^Destroy it.

c-0: ^You didn't destroy the factory. Your neighbours and family ask, "WHY DIDN'T YOU DESTROY THE FACTORY? NOW WE ARE SURELY DOOMED!".

s: ^It would have been a selfish act harming more people
^I didn't know any better
^Other

c-1: ^You live in a world depended on local factories. You happen to work at one of these factories, which provides you with just enough income to live. However, your factory is a major pollutant for its environment and people living nearby are not able to grow any crops which is causing them to starve.

^You have the option to close the factory out of empathy for the neighboring community that is affected by the pollution. Or you can keep the factory open to keep supporting you own small community of factory workers.

s: ^Close it.
^Keep it open.

c-2: ^You live in a world defined by luxury and pleasure, and you haven't experienced much difficulty in your life. You live in a paradise surrounded by walls, seperating you from other classes. Your pleasure comes at the cost of others and you have a lot of influence in deciding the future.

^You hear news of an investment opportunity that is coming up. You can invest in a factory of a lower class community, which could allow for their community to become more self-sustaining. Your other option is to invest more in upcoming fusion reactor developments, which could boost your own community's energy production exponentially.

s: ^Invest
^Invest

c-0: ^ in the neighboring lower class community.
c-1: ^ in the upcoming fusion reactor developments.

factoryNotDestroyed: ^Over the upcoming days you try to come up with different food sources. But nothing seems to work. You desperately move to the bigger city to try and ask them for help.
destroyFactory: ^The factory is now gone. You might by able to create a new form of food and income for your community. However, you must provide for a lot more people who were depended on the factory. They are angry at you and demand an explanation and reasoning as to why you destroyed their factory.

s: ^"Sometimes you got to make sacrificies to make our world a better place."
^"I had no choice! Otherwise, I had no food for myself and my community."

keepFactoryOpen: ^You keep the factory open. You are still able to barely support your own community. But the land of your neighbours next to you is completely destroyed and they have nothing left. Your neighbours wonder why you didn't close the factory.

s: ^"I have to support my own community first. I can't risk getting more people in trouble."
^"Otherwise these people will never learn how to be autonomous like us."

promotion: ^Things are going well in the factory and you have been promoted. There is a new budget and you get to decide how it should be spend. You have the option of helping out your neighbors by investing in soil fertility reparation, or you can upgrade the factory which would increase the production. The latter could mean that enough food could be produced for the whole community, but it could potentially harm the environment even more.

s: ^Invest in the soil fertility program.
^Upgrade the production.

newLife: ^Over the upcoming days you try to come up with new food sources. You can stay with your community to try and improve your life there by slowly trying to rebuild food and production, with a possible chance of failure. Or you can move to the big city and try to rebuild your life there with your community, while its still possible. This requires everyone to abandon their lives.

s: ^Rebuild from the ground up.
^Seek a new life in the big city.

investInCommunity: ^Your investment turned out to be a great success, and the energy production of your community has skyrocketed. Some people are complaining though about the stench that is coming over the wall of your community. Some argue that an investment in the factory would have been a better option. Yet you argue that:

s: ^"Its better to fix your own problems first before you try to fix that of others."
^"The other community needs to learn how to be autonomous, which they have to achieve without external aid."

utopia: ^You are able to maintain an utopian community. Chaos does seem to be present over the walls of your paradise, yet it doesn't really affect your quality of life. You and your peers have come to a consensus that these  external problems will have to be fixed by themselves, which is just a matter of time.
investInFactory: ^You invest in the factory of the neighbouring community. They are grateful for your help but your own community is dissatisfied. You are wealthy but still have lots of other problems that require investing. They demand to know why you refuse to fix your own community's problems first.

s: ^"We are wealthy enough the try and help others to achieve the same level of wealth. Maybe we can use them in the future to trade with."
^"We have to show good will to others from time to time. In the future we will focus more on ourselves again."

afterInvestingInFactory: ^After you invested you hear that the other community wants even more money and resources from you. They can't keep up themselves and need you to keep supporting them more and more. You realize they have become dependent on you. You can chose to keep investing in them or pull all the funds from them.

s: ^Keep investing
^Pull all funds

flee: ^When you arrive at the gates of the big cities, you must plead your case before the others will let you in. You have tried everything but it seems that the city has no place for you.

b: ^As you plead your case to the city head, you mention all the efforts that you made for your community to try and improve the living conditions. The city head argues that you should have made other decisions. If they decide to take more people like you in, the city will also slowly deteriorate. The big city isn't able to take in anymore refugees. You have to go somewhere else.

^ As you plead your case to the city head, you mention all the difficult decisions that you had to make to get here. The city head argues that your decisions were self-centered, and there is no place for such personalities in the big city. You should have remained loyal to your own community, like we are supposed to.

rebuildSoil: ^Your decision to take care of your community seems to pay off. The situation is more stable and you can support your own community a little bit better with improved living conditions and overall wealth as result. You are still not risk free. but you have learned that it is possible to improve a situation with a little investment. With this new perspective you decide to meet with the other leaders, to try and convince them that you could build a better world for everybody to live in.

b: ^ Now that you were able to rebuild some parts of your food resources, things are going well. Now you argue with the big city to reform their industry as well to be less polluting, which would make it possible to create better living conditions and to allow even more communities to be raised out of poverty. The city's head argues that taking a risk like this could have disastrous consequences for the community. He states that in your case, taking the risk of shutting down the factory could only have been beneficial because you had nothing to lose anyways. Its a different story for the big city.

^ Through investment in your own community you got some great progress. But the lower community has now become heavily dependent on your resources. The lower class argues that there is nothing wrong with being dependent on you for a while. And they will hopefully also become self-reliant in the future, before the resources run out again.

upgrade: ^You invest again in the community. You see the effect your actions have on the lower community. It did however cost some of your own progress. But the world is a bit easier to live in for them. You decide to meet with the other community leaders to discuss your actions.

b: ^ Your investment in the factory has increased living standards substantially. However, the increase of food production comes at a cost. The environmental impact of the factory is apparent and more people are getting sick. The lower class argues that the money would have been better spent on soil repairs, instead of making people more reliant on the polluting factory.

^ After continuously investing in lower communities, your own living conditions in the big city have slowly decreased. Your own people are not really satisfied anymore as they had to sacrifice their own lifestyles. The lower communities have been able to improve their living conditions. However, they have become really dependent on you and you must keep investing in them. While the living conditions in your own city deteriorate.

focusOnYourself: ^The other communities outside your city walls are destroyed. They were not able to sustain or rebuild themselves. They come knocking at your city walls asking for help. You don't know what decisions they have made that lead them to that situation. Maybe they destroyed themselves or maybe you caused their misfortune. But now a stream of refugees is headed towards your city.

b: ^ Your irregular investments had detrimental consequences for the other communities. By first making them depent on you and then pulling your funds, chaos emerged. Immigrants are now lining up at the gates, demanding answers and entrance. You know that you can't let these people in, because it would disrupt the city. You are going to have to tell these people to find some other place, yet you know that there are no alternatives for them.

^ Due to your own progress, you have made your community very attractive to refugees. These immigrants are knocking at your city walls. They demand that it's time to give back to the other communities as you have plenty of resources to spare. You now have to deal with the faith of even more people, and how you open up your community to distribute the wealth.
